research_metadata.methodology: Web search analysis of 5 key research queries

tripadvisor.weakness: Not focused on local daily discovery

eventbrite.pricing: Free tier + Essentials + Professional (3.7% + $1.79 per paid ticket + 2.9% processing fee)
eventbrite.weakness: Minimal customization, higher fees for small events

meetup.weakness: Lower user satisfaction (3.0 rating), limited professional features

google_maps.market_share: 92% of local consumer engagement (Google, Bing, Apple, Facebook combined)
google_maps.strength: 20% of all local searches start here, deep Google Search integration, AI-powered discovery

apple_maps.primary_use: Business discovery via Siri and Apple devices
apple_maps.market_share: 50% of smartphone users use voice search daily (Siri integration)
apple_maps.strength: Apple Business Connect, integration with calendar and Siri
apple_maps.weakness: Limited to Apple ecosystem, relies on Yelp/Foursquare data

platform_segmentation.gap_identified: No unified platform combining local business discovery + events + activities + community in one seamless experience

growth_drivers: Rise in field marketing and regional events

key_trends_2025.field_marketing_rise: 75% of respondents indicate small in-person events executed regionally
key_trends_2025.budget_growth: 53.2% of organizers expect budgets to grow in 2025
key_trends_2025.corporate_event_growth: Rising number of corporate events driving market expansion

map_platform_dominance.share_of_local_searches: 20% of all local searches start on map platforms
map_platform_dominance.top_platforms: Google Maps, Apple Maps, Bing Maps
map_platform_dominance.consumer_engagement: 92% happens on Google, Bing, Apple, Facebook

google_maps_advantages.visibility: Local pack placement, voice search optimization
google_maps_advantages.ai_features: Generative AI for discovery and navigation

apple_maps_advantages.device_integration: Siri, calendar integration on Apple devices
apple_maps_advantages.voice_search: 50% of smartphone users use voice search daily
apple_maps_advantages.business_tools: Apple Business Connect for custom place cards

user_retention_benchmarks.context: Low retention partly due to infrequent use patterns (e.g., hotel apps used once per year for vacation)
user_retention_benchmarks.industry_comparison: Travel apps have among the lowest retention rates across all app categories
user_retention_benchmarks.implication: Retention strategies must account for episodic usage and provide continuous value beyond single-use scenarios

yelp_tripadvisor: No integrated event discovery or ticketing
Focus on reviews, not real-time activities
eventbrite_meetup: Eventbrite: High fees deter small organizers (3.7% + $1.79 + 2.9%)
Meetup: Low user satisfaction (3.0 rating), unclear pricing
Not designed for spontaneous discovery or daily use
google_apple_maps: Limited community and social engagement features
No integrated ticketing or RSVP functionality
city_discovery_apps_general: Information overload for users visiting new cities
Poor customer service and refund policies

unified_experience.description: Single app combining business discovery + events + activities + community
unified_experience.gap: Users currently need 3-5 apps for complete city experience
unified_experience.value_proposition: One-stop platform for 'What's happening right now?'

local_first_approach.description: Focus on daily local discovery vs occasional travel
local_first_approach.retention_strategy: Daily utility drives higher engagement than trip-based apps
local_first_approach.differentiation: Compete on frequency of use, not depth of travel content

simplified_information_architecture.description: Combat information overload with curated, context-aware recommendations
simplified_information_architecture.user_pain_point: Visitors to new cities feel overwhelmed by complex transport and activity options
simplified_information_architecture.solution: AI-powered personalization, location-aware filtering, simple UI

free_or_low_cost_model.description: Undercut Eventbrite fees to attract small event organizers and community builders
free_or_low_cost_model.competitor_weakness: Eventbrite fees (7.4% total) are barrier for grassroots events
free_or_low_cost_model.monetization_alternative: Freemium with ads, premium business listings, sponsored discovery

voice_and_ai_integration.description: Leverage 50% daily voice search usage with conversational discovery
voice_and_ai_integration.user_behavior: Siri/Google Assistant users already search for 'things to do nearby'

hybrid_and_field_events.description: Support 75% preference for small, regional, field-executed events
hybrid_and_field_events.market_trend: Shift from large conferences to distributed local experiences
hybrid_and_field_events.platform_feature: Tools for organizers to create and promote local micro-events

sam_serviceable_available_market.local_events_and_discovery: Estimated 10-15% of total events market focused on local/city-level discovery
sam_serviceable_available_market.rough_estimate: $50-70 billion USD (US market for local event and activity discovery)

som_serviceable_obtainable_market.initial_target: Urban millennials and Gen Z (18-40) in top 20 US metro areas
som_serviceable_obtainable_market.market_penetration_goal: 0.1% of local events market in Year 1 = $50-70 million addressable

key_insights.market_fragmentation: No dominant player owns the full 'local discovery + events + activities' value chain
key_insights.low_satisfaction: Meetup (3.0 rating) and general city discovery app complaints indicate user frustration
key_insights.retention_challenge: Travel/lifestyle apps have 2.8% day-30 retention - must design for daily utility
key_insights.growth_momentum: Events industry growing 5-14% CAGR with $1+ trillion growth opportunity by 2029
key_insights.technology_tailwinds: AI, voice search, hybrid events all favor new entrants with modern tech stacks
key_insights.fee_sensitivity: Eventbrite's 7.4% total fees create opening for free or low-cost alternative
